title: Chimps and Fermented Fruit: A Fun Science Story
summary: Scientists studied chimpanzees in Africa to learn about their eating habits. They found that chimps eat a lot of fermented fruit, which has alcohol in it. To check this, graduate students collected chimp urine and tested it. The tests showed that most urine had alcohol byproducts, meaning the chimps are drinking alcohol from the fruit. This supports a theory called the "drunken monkey hypothesis," which says that humans and apes have liked alcohol for millions of years because of eating fermented fruit. The study helps us understand why animals, including humans, might enjoy alcohol. Some chimps, like females and young ones, did not have alcohol in their urine, so scientists want to study more in the future. This research shows how food and alcohol are connected in nature.

background_read: Chimpanzees are smart animals that live in forests in Africa. They eat fruits, leaves, and sometimes insects. Fermented fruit is fruit that has started to rot and can have alcohol in it, which is the same thing found in drinks like beer. Scientists have a theory that humans and apes might have started liking alcohol a long time ago because they ate this kind of fruit. This study helps us learn more about animal behavior and how it connects to humans.
